isis.stitle: TSI 03-09-02 - Fender Paint Surface With Star Cracks

subjectgroup.subject: Fender Paint Surface With Star Cracks

geninfo.para: Star cracks, in the painted surface of hand sprayed fiberglass fenders, can occur when stones or other solid debris thrown by the tires strike the inner (underside) fender surface. To prevent star cracking before it occurs or after repairs have been made, it is recommended that adhesive-backed urethane sheet material, International Part Number 991917C1, or undercoating, 3M Part Number 051135-08881, be applied to the inner fender surfaces.

Prior to applying the urethane sheeting or undercoating, the inner surfaces of the fender must be prepared. For maximum performance, the surfaces should be cleaned and primed using primer wash with Scotch-Brite™ scrub pads and clean rags, or cleaned with solvent and brush primed. The recommended primer wash is Ashland Chemical, Inc' s PLIOSEAL™ 5637A.
Before installing the urethane sheeting, determine the size and shape of the area to be covered. Cut the urethane sheet to fit.

note.para: Do not remove the protective paper backing until you are ready to install onto the prepared surface. Exposing the adhesive may cause contamination and affect the maximum bond strength.

geninfo.para: Move the fitted urethane sheet into contact with the prepared inner fender surface ( Figure 1) and slowly peel off the protective paper backing to minimize the formation of air bubbles, taking care not to touch the adhesive while applying the material. Maximum adhesion will be obtained if a small firm roller is used to exert additional pressure on the urethane sheet after the application is complete.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Apply Urethane Sheet to Underside of Fender (Arrow)

geninfo.para: Prepare the inner fender surface as described in the previous section. Apply 3M undercoating Part Number 051135-08881 to a thickness of .030 inch. Approximately 5 aerosol cans of 3M undercoating will be needed per vehicle. Allow 24 hours cure time before placing the vehicle in service.
